Autism refers to a broad range of conditions characterized by challenges with social skills, repetitive behaviors, speech and nonverbal communication.

patterns: Is there a test for autism
responses: There is no blood test to diagnose autism spectrum disorder. A diagnosis is made based on behaviors. In order to be diagnosed with autism, an individual must display deficits in social communication and social interaction, and show restrictive and repetitive behavior

patterns: How can I find out what caused my child's autism
What is the reasons of autism
What is the cause of autism
responses: In most individuals it is currently not possible to identify the exact cause of autism. There are a few genetic syndromes associated with autism
At this time, there is no evidence that specific chemicals in the environment, immunization practices or dietary differences cause autism.

patterns: Can you tell which side of the family the autism came from
Can we tell which side of the family the autism came from
responses: If your child has autism and you are interested in genetic testing, you can ask your child's doctor for a referral to a medical geneticist. After conducting a detailed family history and physical exam of your child, the doctor may recommend genetic testing, which usually is a blood test and sometimes a urine test.

patterns: How can I find the best treatments for my child
What is the best treatment for autism
How can i find the best treatments for autism
responses: Research suggests that early intensive behavioral intervention, based on applied behavioral analysis, is effective at improving language, function and behavior in individuals with autism. There are two drugs, risperidone and aripiprazole, that can improve challenging behaviors such as emotional distress, aggression, hyperactivity and self-injury, but these drugs do not lead to improvements in social skills or communication. Interventions focused on parent training and cognitive behavioral therapy can improve social skills, communication, language use and management of challenging behaviors.

patterns: What progress has been made so far in autism research
What progress has been made in asd research
responses: In the past five years, scientists have made significant progress in discovering the genes that contribute to autism. With this knowledge, there has also been much progress in understanding what might be different in the cells of the brain of a person with autism.

patterns: How can I help my child?
How can I help child with autism?
responses: Make an effort to catch them doing something good, reward them when they act appropriately or learn a new skill.
Create a private space in your home where your child can relax
If you are observant and aware, you can learn to pick up on the nonverbal cues that children with ASD use to communicate
Schedule playtime when your child is most alert and awake.
Create a personalized autism treatment plan

Join an ASD support group such this app, is a great way to meet other families dealing with the same challenges you are. Parents can share information, get advice, and lean on each other for emotional support. Just being around others in the same boat and sharing their experience
Create consistency in the child’s environment which is the best way to reinforce learning. Find out what the child’s therapists are doing and continue their techniques at home.

Pay attention to your child’s sensory sensitivities and Figure out what sights, sounds, smells, movements, and tactile sensations trigger your kid’s “bad” or disruptive behaviors and what elicits a positive response.
Use the social stories, social stories can be a useful way of explaining how to manage anger.

Find out if the child is being bullied, the childs with ASD are at more risk of being bullied than their peers. Some will have difficulty recognising what bullying is, and may not be able to describe what has happened.
